Package org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.serialize

Class Format

java.lang.Object
org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.serialize.Format
public class Format extends Object
Format used for exporting a DiffTree. For easy reusability this class is composed of separate node and edge formats. The exported DiffTree can be influenced in the following ways: - Providing both a node and an edge label format. - Changing the order, filtering or adding the nodes and edges by creating a subclass of Format.

  • Method Details

    • getNodeFormat

      public DiffNodeLabelFormat getNodeFormat()

    • getEdgeFormat

      public EdgeLabelFormat getEdgeFormat()

    • forEachNode

      public void forEachNode​(DiffTree diffTree, Consumer<DiffNode> callback)
      Iterates over all DiffNodes in diffTree and calls callback. Exporters should use this method to enable subclasses of Format to filter nodes, add new nodes and change the order of the exported nodes. This implementation is equivalent to DiffTree.forAll(java.util.function.Consumer<org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffNode>).
      Parameters:
      diffTree - to be exported
      callback - is called for each node

    • forEachEdge

      public void forEachEdge​(DiffTree diffTree, Consumer<StyledEdge> callback)
      Iterates over all edges in diffTree and calls callback. Exporters should use this method to enable subclasses of Format to filter edges, add new edges and change the order of the exported edges. This implementation uses forEachUniqueEdge(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffTree,java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.List<org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.serialize.StyledEdge>>) by calling callback for each edge in the order given by the lists of forEachUniqueEdge(org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.DiffTree,java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.List<org.variantsync.diffdetective.diff.difftree.serialize.StyledEdge>>).
      Parameters:
      diffTree - to be exported
      callback - is called for each edge

    • forEachUniqueEdge

      public void forEachUniqueEdge​(DiffTree diffTree, Consumer<List<StyledEdge>> callback)
      Iterates over all edges in diffTree and calls callback, visiting parallel edges only once. Two edges are parallel if they start at the same node and end at the same node. Note that the direction of directed edges matters. All parallel edges are collected into a list and are passed once to callback. Exporters should use this method to enable subclasses of Format to filter edges, add new edges and change the order of the exported edges.
      Parameters:
      diffTree - to be exported
      callback - is called for each unique edge

    • beforeEdge

      protected StyledEdge beforeEdge​(DiffNode node)
      Constructs a StyledEdge from node and its before parent. The order of these nodes is permuted according to EdgeLabelFormat.getEdgeDirection() of getEdgeFormat().

    • afterEdge

      protected StyledEdge afterEdge​(DiffNode node)
      Constructs a StyledEdge from node and its after parent. The order of these nodes is permuted according to EdgeLabelFormat.getEdgeDirection() of getEdgeFormat().

    • sortedEdgeWithLabel

      protected StyledEdge sortedEdgeWithLabel​(DiffNode originalFrom, DiffNode originalTo, StyledEdge.Style style)
      Constructs a StyledEdge from originalFrom to originalTo. The order of these nodes is permuted according to EdgeLabelFormat.getEdgeDirection() of getEdgeFormat().
      Parameters:
      originalFrom - the origin of the constructed edge
      originalTo - the destination of the constructed edge
      style - the export style of the constructed edge
      Returns:
      a new StyledEdge
